books.title: The Jungle
books.author: Upton Sinclair
books.summary: A working-class Lithuanian immigrant family’s struggle to make a living in the turn-of-the-century Chicago stockyards.

books.title: Ashenden
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short stories based on the experiences of an intelligence agent during World War I.

books.title: Memoirs of a Foxhunting Man
books.author: Siegfried Sassoon
books.summary: A young boy comes of age in the idyllic English countryside just before the Great War tears Europe apart.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Green Forest Stories
books.author: Thornton W. Burgess
books.summary: A collection of four animal tales featuring the denizens of the Green Forest.

books.title: She Stoops to Conquer
books.author: Oliver Goldsmith
books.summary: Two young men visit the countryside: one to find a wife, and the other to avoid one.

books.title: Timon of Athens
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A wealthy Athenian lord becomes poor and friendless after his “friends” take advantage of his hospitality.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: A collection of E. M. Forster’s short stories, ordered by date of their original publication.

books.title: The Child of the Cavern
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: An engineer returns to a depleted coal mine at an old friend’s request and investigates mysterious happenings.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: A collection of nine short fiction works by influential supernatural and horror author Arthur Machen.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective investigates a variety of intriguing cases in the first Holmes short story collection.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.

books.title: The Wealth of Nations
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith lays the foundation of classical economics.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: T. S. Eliot
books.summary: A collection of T. S. Eliot’s poetry, including “The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock,” “The Waste Land,” and “The Hollow Men.”

books.title: The Works of Max Beerbohm
books.author: Max Beerbohm
books.summary: A collection of satirical essays ridiculing pretentiousness through imitation.

books.title: Nordenholt’s Million
books.author: J. J. Connington
books.summary: After a strain of bacteria causes the collapse of the world’s food supply, a plutocrat creates a refuge to try to ensure the survival of a chosen few.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Selma Lagerlöf
books.summary: A collection of Selma Lagerlöf’s translated short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: On a Chinese Screen
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short vignettes about the people and places W. Somerset Maugham encountered during his travels along the Yangtze River in 1919–20.
